Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Android users are automatically signed up to the COVIDSafe app via Google's new Exposure Notifications API, implying that it is happening without their consent.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is contradicted by cybersecurity experts and the explanation provided by Vanessa Teague.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the Exposure Notifications API functions in the same way as a contact tracing app.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of alternative explanations being presented in the claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Exposure Notifications API is not an app and does not function in the same way as a contact tracing app.
